legal_mapping: Victims’ Code — Right to be kept informed; to make a complaint; to be treated with respect
DPA 2018 / UK GDPR — access to personal data (Art. 15); policing Part 3 integrity/accuracy
ECHR Article 2 operational duties — safeguarding where risk of self-harm is known

content.summary: Complaints team discusses Ben’s dissatisfaction with OIC PC Dixon, confirms two crime references (July and November), and states the live reference is the July case (ending 246). The call also records that Ben’s suicide attempt on 6 April was only logged on the 17th, after the OIC went on leave, reinforcing the ‘holiday alibi’ gap and record-integrity issues. Call-taker suggests using SAR for file access and proposes supervisor follow-up.

police_position.investigation_status: Live case is July reference (47240141246) per call-taker
police_position.access_guidance: Advises Subject Access Request (SAR) for file access

contradictions.claim: Suicide attempt on 06-04-2025 was not logged until 17-04-2025 while OIC and supervisors were on leave.
Confusion over whether July or November is the live case; call confirms July is live while other messaging suggested otherwise.
Complaints call directs victim to SAR to access files during live safeguarding concerns.
Persistent emphasis on OIC/supervisors being on leave amid critical safeguarding updates.
Caller alleges OIC deleted files and moved goalposts to make July evidence look newly submitted.
